name: Semantics of Staking: Fun and Games (and Balance Sheets) with Staking Tokens
description: We continue our exploration of the various Principal-Agent problems at play in decentralised systems by shining a light on staking. We provide some thoughts prompted by an exercise in formalising existing constructions with a systematic review. We discuss architectures of liquid staking and re-staking, and everything in-between and beyond.

speakers.name: Barnabé Monnot
speakers.bio: Barnabé is a research scientist at the Robust Incentives Group. He has published many fundamental pieces on Proposer-Builder Separation and Principal-Agent problems in the Ethereum protocol.
